note: Minuscule with abbreviations and cursive elements. Yellow wash used for highlighting titles and rubrics (e.g. on fol. 53r), indicating south Italian origin. Typical Salentine traits are also: side bands that resemble vegetal motifs (e.g. fols. 55r, 81v, 93r), omicron en rondelle, initials with double outline, asterisk with arrowheads
The undertext runs parallel to the overtext
Each side preserves between 19 and 26 lines of text, 6 mm apart and arranged in a single column

A single folio of Sin. gr. 966 corresponds to a single folio of the original manuscript, suggesting that the original manuscript was of similar dimensions: approximately 175x120 mm (oblong in height). The Schriftspiegel is approximately 135x90 mm, with margins measuring 20 mm (outer), 15 mm (inner), 30 mm (lower) and 20 mm (upper) (f. 71r)

Prickings are still visible in the margins (e.g. fol. 95), elongated in shape and likely made with a penknife. The scheme of ruled lines which support the writing corresponds to Leroy’s index X. This kind of ruling is often found in manuscripts written in Salento (Southern Italy)

note.value: Sinai Greek NF M 21, ff. 4-7 contains parts of this same text

Seven quires can be reconstructed. Quire 1: ff. 71, 84, 65, 92, 89, 68, 81, 78 (complete); Quire 2: ff. 95, 76, 101, 90, 91, 96, 73, 102 (complete, with quire mark on f. 95r); Quire 3: ff. 55, 70, 77, 50, 51, 72, 63, 62 (complete); Quire 4: ff. 53, 66, 100, 97, 67, 48 (quire mark on f. 53r. Third bifolio is missing); Quire 5: ff. 87, 88, 99, 64, 69, 98, 93, 94 (complete, with quire mark on f. 87r); Quire 6: ff. 83, 60, 75, 74, 57, 82 (quire mark on f. 83r. Central bifolio is missing); Quire 7: ff. 79, 54, 61, 52, 80, 85, 49, 56, 47, 86 (complete, with quire mark on f. 79r) (Rossetto)
Description of undertext by Ernst Gamillscheg, Giulia Rossetto
